post_text: Jemez Valley Public Schools would like to welcome new and returning families for the 2020-2021 school year. Per JVPS Board of Education and in accordance with the current school re-entry guideline by NM Governor Michelle Lujan Grisham, all JVPS students will participate in Remote Learning for the entire 1st Quarter (August 10th to October 16th) of the Fall Semester. Please help us prepare your student for a successful school year by completing a survey for your JVPS student(s) (grades PreK to 12th) within your household. The survey link will be sent to the parent/guardian email address on file.
text: Jemez Valley Public Schools would like to welcome new and returning families for the 2020-2021 school year. Per JVPS Board of Education and in accordance with the current school re-entry guideline by NM Governor Michelle Lujan Grisham, all JVPS students will participate in Remote Learning for the entire 1st Quarter (August 10th to October 16th) of the Fall Semester. Please help us prepare your student for a successful school year by completing a survey for your JVPS student(s) (grades PreK to 12th) within your household. The survey link will be sent to the parent/guardian email address on file.

post_text:
Parents & Guardians,

Although the school year is just ending, we are already preparing for the yearly registration for the 2020-2021 school year. Once again, registration will be online. The online registration through Skyward Family Access for the 2020-21 school year opens July 6, 2020.

Please make sure that you know your user name and password for Skyward Family Access. You must know this information in order to enroll your student/s for the upcoming school year. If you don't know, or have, this information, please call the school secretary before June 10, 2020.

Elementary School: (575) 834-7393 ext 309 or (505) 373-0054 ext 309

Middle & High School: (575) 834-7392 ext 312 or (505) 373-0137 ext 312

post_text:
End of year reminders and return of school property:

Tuesday, June 2nd, all students must return their iPad, device accessories, and textbooks to Jemez Valley Public Schools.

For those students residing in Jemez Pueblo or Zia Pueblo, the district is working with these communities to finalize the logistics for the collection of school property.

For students living in Ponderosa, San Ysidro, Jemez Springs, or La Cueva, parents will need to return all school property to the bus lane of the elementary school as follows:

9:00 am Families with last names A – G

10:00 am Families with last names H – M

11:00 am Families with last names N - Z



If you have any questions please contact your student’s school office. For the Elementary School call (505) 373-0054 ext. 309, and for the Middle and High Schools call (505) 373-0137 ext. 312.

Thank you and be safe.

post_text:
We hope your family is well. The traditional school year for grading will end on May 28th for grades 6th thru 11th. Final grades will be submitted for report card purposes on June 2nd. For students to receive the allotted 10 points per class, all assignments must be returned to the school or teacher by May 28th. Students not receiving hard copy assignments should submit electronic assignments through Google Classroom or Email. For those students receiving hard copy assignments, those documents should be returned to the school via the school bus during meal distribution. For students residing in Zia Pueblo, please return assignments to Mr. Jonathan Pino of the Education Department.

If you have any questions please call the High School at (505) 373-0137 ext 312 or (575) 834-7392 ext. 312 as soon as possible.

Be safe.

post_text: NMSU Indian Resources Development is offering a virtual summer camp called Dream Keepers Online! The camp is June 15 – July 24, 2020 for Native American high school students entering 10th, 11th, and 12th grades. DK-O is free and a great way to explore college and discover careers. Apply today at ird.nmsu.edu/dkc!

post_text:
News about COVID-19 (Coronavirus) may create anxiety, fear, depression and mental health concerns. If you or a loved one is experiencing any kind of emotional crisis, mental health or substance use concern, counselors are available to assist you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

Call the NM Crisis & Access Line at 1-855-662-7474 (24/7); call or text their Peer-to-Peer Warmline at 1-855-466-7100 (call 3:30pm-11:30pm; text 6pm-11pm); and visit the NM Crisis and Access Line -

https://www.nmcrisisline.com

post_text:
Common Sense Media is the nation's leading nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the lives of kids and families by providing the trustworthy information, education, and independent voice they need to thrive in the 21st century.
They recently launched a brand-new, free online resource to support families and educators who are transitioning to remote learning as a result of the coronavirus: Wide Open School.

Common Sense Media has specifically addressed SEL for grades prek-5 and for grades 6-12. https://wideopenschool.org/programs/family/prek-5/emotional-well-being/

https://wideopenschool.org/programs/family/6-12/emotional-well-being/

post_text: Emergency Offerings for Internet Service
shared_text:
Jemez Valley Public Schools
March 26 at 9:42 PM ·

The New Mexico Public Education Department has compiled a list of Internet Service Provider Emergency Offerings.

Additionally, Lifeline is a federal program that lowers the monthly cost of phone and internet. Eligible customers will get up to $9.25 toward their bill. You can only use Lifeline for either phone or internet, but not both. Visit their website to review qualification guidelines, get Lifeline, and find a company near you.

Do I Qualify: https://www.lifelinesupport.org/do-i-qualify/
Apply for Lifeline: https://nationalverifier.service-now.com/lifeline

Click here to review the flyer with Internet Service Providers from NMPED: https://webnew.ped.state.nm.us/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ISPsupportforhomeworkgap_v5.pdf
text:
Emergency Offerings for Internet Service

March 26 at 9:42 PM ·

The New Mexico Public Education Department has compiled a list of Internet Service Provider Emergency Offerings.

Additionally, Lifeline is a federal program that lowers the monthly cost of phone and internet. Eligible customers will get up to $9.25 toward their bill. You can only use Lifeline for either phone or internet, but not both. Visit their website to review qualification guidelines, get Lifeline, and find a company near you.

Do I Qualify: https://www.lifelinesupport.org/do-i-qualify/

shared_text:
Jemez Valley Public Schools
March 18 at 12:44 AM ·

As you know, each day the Jemez Valley Public Schools is delivering breakfast and lunch to each of our students via buses to regular bus stop between 9:00 and 9:30 a.m.. If you are unable to receive the meals at that time, the undelivered meals will be held until 1:30 p.m. at the following locations:

Zia Pueblo Families - The Zia Elder Center

Jemez Pueblo Families -The Jemez Ed Department

Ponderosa Area Families - The Jemez Valley High School Cafeteria

Jemez Springs Families - The Village Office, contact is Emily

We expect any extra meals to be at the above locations by 11 am. After 1:30, the undelivered meals will be given away or disposed of.

This afternoon, we sent out a survey via robo calls regarding internet access and student access to a computer or mobile device at home. We would greatly appreciate your answering the short survey either by phone or in the email link you will receive.

Thank you

Jemez Valley Public Schools

VECTORSOLUTIONS.COM
Vector Cares - Free Training Courses for Our Community

Jemez Valley Public Schools
March 15 at 6:13 PM ·

Vector has launched a complimentary coronavirus (COVID-19) video microcourse to help you and your loved ones stay safe and healthy. Available now, this course features critical information about the coronavirus, including:

How coronavirus spreads
How to recognize symptoms
How to prevent and treat the virus
What to do if you become sick with the virus
We strongly encourage you to share this video resource with your family members, friends, and colleagues so that everyone can collectively take proactive steps to stay healthy and prevent the spread of the virus.

Vector will update the course content with the latest information about the virus as it becomes available.

https://www.vectorsolutions.com/about-us/vector-cares/

Yesterday, the service used to send automated calls, emails and texts experienced delivery issues, delays and at times, messages not being delivered due to high usage. Please continue checking our website, facebook pages or call the main school lines for current updates.

If you would like to receive text messages and currently do not receive them, you must Opt-in by texting "y" to 67587. You may also opt-in in Skyward Family Access.

post_text:
As mandated by Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham, the New Mexico Public Education Department and the state Department of Health JVPS will be closed for three weeks beginning Monday, March 16th. School will resume Monday, April 6th.

We will communicate with parents and guardians by automated calls and emails as information is available.

Please ensure all phone numbers and emails are current. You may update your phone number by calling the school and leaving a message with your full name, your student’s full name and grade, along with the phone number or email address.

Elementary Office: 505-373-0054 ext 309 or 575-834-7393 ext 309

Middle/High School Office: 505-373-0137 ext 312 or 575-834-7392 ext 312

shared_text:
Jemez Valley Public Schools
February 11 at 11:34 PM ·

RIDE THE BUS TO SCHOOL TOMORROW, WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 12TH

Wednesday, February 12th is the 120th Day where student ridership on the District’s school buses determines the amount of transportation funds the district will receive for next school year. It is extremely important that all JVPS students ride the bus at least once, to or from school today

For students who drive to school and students that are driven to school, the District requests that these students park or get dropped off at the football field where a bus will transport them to the school. Buses will begin arriving at the football field for student pickup from 7:20 a.m. to 7:50 a.m.

Please ensure your student rides the bus to school or gets dropped off at the football field during designated time frame. We appreciate the support of parents and students as every student counted today is funding to meet the needs of our students.
